=== Ubuntu Developer Summit : Mountain View 2006 : Ubuntu Education Interests ===

A narrowed-down list from:
* <nowiki>[[https://features.launchpad.net/sprints/uds-mtv|UDS MTV Feature Specifications]]</nowiki>
** relevant to '''Ubuntu Education'''.

Please also see:
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.edubuntu.org/UdsMtvEdubuntu|UDS MTV Edubuntu]]</nowiki>
** for specifications relevant to '''Edubuntu'''.

Created:
* 2006-11-01, 21:30 UTC
* by PhilippSchroeder (pips1)
* Contributors
** PhilippSchroeder
** RichardWeideman (riched)

We use the following list to coordinate which BOF Meetings we will attend. We will make an effort to contribute to BOFs most important to Ubuntu Education - either by dividing them up amongst us, or attending them jointly.

==== Missing Specifications ====

 1. Edubuntu Configurations
** Existing : Current Edubuntu "bundle / package" is for Primary Schools
** Required : Need Edubuntu "bundle / packge" for Seconday Schools
** Required : Need Edubuntu "bundle / packge" for University

 2. Edubuntu-Product-and-Add-On
** Does it make sense to see Edubuntu as: Ubuntu base + Edubuntu Add-On
** Would this approach assist for the 3 bundle / packages:
** Edubuntu Primary
** Edubuntu Secondary
** Edubuntu University
** Would this approach assist with the single CD size constraints

 3. Ubuntu-Education-Network-Integration
** {bring requested features in here}

 4. Edubuntu-Desktop-Applications
** {bring requested applications in here}

 5. Edubuntu-Web-Applications
** {bring requested applications in here}

 6. Ubuntu-Education-Content
** {expand this}

==== Concepts to Promote / Explain at UDS ====

* Which features requested by Education apply to all Ubuntu audiences
** ''Can we drive these features upstream to Ubuntu ?''
** Take advantage of a bigger development team
** Feature Benefits become available to all variants

* Ubuntu and Education Community Space
** We are creating an Ubuntu and Education Community Space''
** This space will host:
   1. user discussions on '''current use of Ububuntu in Education'''
*** Ubuntu
*** Edubuntu
*** Kubuntu
*** Xubuntu
   2. '''3rd party education applications''' in current use by the community
*** where to get them
*** some unofficial guidelines to usage
*** forums for unofficial peer support
   3. '''3rd party education tools''' in current use by the community
*** where to get them
*** some unofficial guidelines to usage
*** forums for unofficial peer support
   4. '''Content Sites''' in current use by the community
*** where to get them
*** some unofficial guidelines to usage
*** forums for unofficial peer support

** This '''unofficial space allows people to share and discuss and test''':
** broader than of current *buntu bundles
** outside of official Ubuntu policy
*** usage is on an "as is basis"
*** licence issues are up to the individual
*** outside of official policy or blessing of:
*** Canonical
*** Ubuntu
*** Edubuntu

** This space allows us to '''identify Applications, Tools or Content''' that prove to be:
** Broadly adopted
** Well supported
** Of significant benefit to education
** Compliant with our licence and philosophy

** Applications, Tools or Content that fit the criteria will have a chance to '''move upstream''' through a formal process i.e.
** consider bundling
** consider integration
** consider partnerships
